name: Worm.is: The Game
description: Smash worms or slither trying! Warning: Incredibly addicting Multiplayer Game!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 2.33GHz or faster x86-compatible processor Memory: 512 MB RAM

reviews.review_text: This game is a HUGE CRAPPIER VERSION of slither.io  Extreme rip-off of the concept.  Not recommened unless you like playing horribly made games.  To elaborate a little bit, the worms move horribly choppy, they look horrible since they are just circles stacked on each other.  You can't kill other worms without getting lucky, the hit boxes are insansely small on the heads.  NOT RECOMENDED! AVOID.  -uninstalled.

Horrible music that you cant turn off unless you sign up

Overall, I would like to give this a positive review. It's pretty fun, and of course I'll keep playing it when I'm bored. However, I'm pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥, because in the middle of a game, I was almost at the top of the leaderboard, and an advertisement for another one of their games pops up, causing me to run into someone and die.  Other popups have shown up as well, but none of them had been in the middle of a game...  Still like a 7/10 game but I'm really salty about that >_>

Alright, so having played Slither.io and knowing full well that this is a clone of Slither.io... I went into this game already not expecting too much. As you can see I don't have much time spent in this game, I played about 15-20 minutes and that is pretty much all I could handle of it. The creators of this game also have a very awful clone of Agar.io called Mitos.is. So, this game is very clearly a port to steam from mobile, and we all know how clones of clones of clones of original games run rampant on mobile game stores, this is no exception. Though there were a couple things about this game that I liked and I will state them below in a list starting with the good.  THE GOOD:  - Multiple Game Modes (something Slither.io does not have) - Apparently this game has levels, upgrades, and pets. (something Slither.io does not have)  THE BAD:  - I was blasted with an ad immediately upon starting the game bribing me with coins for a rating. - Clear and shameless clone of Slither.io with not enough originality to make it acceptable. - Worse graphics than Slither.io - Chat... which is stupid, I challenge you to type without dying while playing this. - Chat requires an account with them, yeah no thanks. - No steam integration... you have to actually sign up with them for your own Screen Name, it does not automatically use your steam name like most other steam games. - Poor English, an example is when I came in second in 'Hunger Games' and got a message saying 'You Are Second Position' - Your snake/worm does not grow past a certain unimpressive size unlike Slither.io where you become terrifyingly large. - My ears were molested by dubstep the entire time I was playing this. - Hit Boxes are bugged, sometimes you will die when you feel like you made no contact, sometimes you can literally crawl right over another worm without dying. - The UI is messy at best, and the whole thing looks incredibly unappealing to the eye.  This game is not only an uncreative clone, but its subpar in comparison to the orginal... very very little effort went into this game period. Why steam allowed this rubbish is beyond me.

Worm.is features some magnificant gameplay and is teaming with oldschool player versus player ethics. It is a technical breakthrough and shows how simplicity and creativity can bring about a master piece. Worm.is raises the standards of todays indie genre and should set an example to the bigger players in the game. I recommend every person to at least try Worm.is and I guarantee that it will raise your own standards along with your passion to play this game.

I've played this game for exactly 6 minutes. I see no difference. Okay, yes, this is a Free-To-Play gane, but you don't even need to play the game to know this is a slither.io ripoff. These excuses about 'Oh, it has music!' or some other bull doesn't change that you can simply just open up your web browser and search 'slither.io' to get pretty much the same experience. No music? Download something and play it in the background. This game isn't worth wasting your time on. This really makes me worry about the gaming community, not the players, but the small developers. We've seen good games made by small devs with original ideas, but this game isn't one of them.The only difference between slither.io and worm.is, is the fact that worm.is has supposed microtransactions. So long story short? The creators here seem to have the creativity of a COD playing 12 year old that doesn't like doing their chores so they end up relying on others to do their stuff for them.

If I could, I would do a 50/50 recommendation.    Worm.is (as has been said many times) pretty much a slither.io copy.   Pros: Simple design Way better network connection compared to slither.io Ability to make account w/ levels and have 'friends'  Cons: Copy of slither.io Just circles stuck together with eyes (slither.io does look better tbh) Not much variety of skins compared to slither.io Absolutely TERRIBLE hitbox  All in all, if it had a better hitbox I  might  give this a positive review.

It has been made apparent by many reviews that this is a copy of Slither.io. I played worm.is first and subsequently played slither.io so I will compare both games.  The hitbox detection is much better in worm.is, with little ambiguity when you run into somebody. It never feels like you've been cheated, whereas in slither.io this is often the case as the hitboxes are smaller than the worms themselves.  There is significantly less lag and stutter in worm.is than slither.io. The ability to choose server is also nice.  One downside is that the pace of the game feels slower in worm.is, the acceleration of the worms is just not very fast. slither.io definitely feels more fast paced. Additionally, the map still feels rather small compared to slither.io.  I started playing after the May 7th update, so perhaps this has fixed many of the issues which older reviews have mentioned.

Pros: -Music -More Skins -Gamemodes (free for all, random teams, hunger games) -Much less lag than slitherio, in options you choose your region  Cons: -Graphics sux (2D, cartoonish) -Maps are small so there is little player count -Head hitbox acts funny sometimes, in slitherio you can see your head touching another snakes body when going around, well here if an enemy snake touches the SIDE of your head, by side i mean the corner between your front and side then you DIE  I still prefer playing the real slither.io although its fun to try new game modes so i would recommend for you to try it out although just to try out   If the develop is reading, i guess you cant update the graphics so i will give other suggestions: - Make maps bigger, in random team gamemode i play like 3 minutes and its game over, there increase the points needed to win  - Make head hitbox smaller like in slither.io -I would urge you to make the graphics look nice like in slitherio.... - Maybe you can add money gamemode, where to enter you need to give like 10 cents, each snake in the map paid 10 cents to join, when you die you get half of your earnings. When a snake dies, a random orb from its body has 5 cents. So you kill 4 snakes that didnt kill anybody and you get 20 cents, in total you have 25 cents if you die you get 12 cents, other enemy snakes search for your other 12 cents. If you add this game will become really addictive. Have a server that minimum to enter is 1 cent, 2nd server with 5 cents, 3rd with 10, 4th with 50 cents, 5th with $1, 6th with $5 and 7th with $10. So you deposit money from either paypal, debit card or SMS, choose to enter a server that requires X amount, use your skill to get money and at the end withdraw instantly. Although you should have good hack protection.

I found Worm.IS to be in ways superior to Slither.io. There's a better turning radius with the snakes, when you consume an enemy you take ALL of their mass, there's randomly generated in-arena spiked barriers which add to the complexity of the gameplay forcing players to take different courses of action, the addition of team gameplay as opposed to FFA, chat in game instead of remaining isolated, and a real ranking system.  The major con of course is that the snake graphics don't look so good, like they were done in MS paint. But with skins, they look excellent. The floor graphics can also do for a makeover. Maybe there's a mod or something. I'll explore that option later.  This is a definite Let's Play.

Excellent game. I\'ve gotten to 11,000 size but my name didn\'t show up in the weekly leaderboards. Slightly disappointing.  I\'ve trapped three people inside my loop of death before at the same time and watched them squirm as I slowly tightened my 10,000 point snake.  10/10 (upvoted) ______________________________________________________________ June 24th, 2016 Updating my review to a not recommended. The last update made items unreachable basically. I have 11 hours in this very polished clone game, and nothing to show for it. My ranks don't even show up in achievement when I get higher than the #1 on the leaderboard.   The only reason I'd upvote it is because of how polished it is compared to slither.io, but even then the cash grab is too strong. If you want decent people to spend money on your game make it beneficial for them as well as everybody else... (don't ♥♥♥♥ people over by giving the people who spend money a gameplay advantage, you ♥♥♥♥♥)
